document_data.name: Hasmet Hudd
document_data.mainbody:
'''Hasmet Hudd''' was a [[gold dwarf]] commoner, displaced by [[The Absolute]], and as a refugee, he sought shelter in [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Gods, we should have just kept going - this place isn't any safer than the last.''|Giftu Hudd}}
document_data.Description: Hasmet was a gruff-looking, fair-skinned gold dwarf with a stubbly beard and curly light hair. He wore a simple blue jerkin.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, an army assembled by the [[Cult of the Absolute]] moved from the [[Moonrise Towers]] in [[Chionthar Valley]] to menace the city of [[Baldur's Gate]], displacing countless refugees in the process along the way. Hasmet Hudd and his brother [[Giftu Hudd]] found their way to the city walls and were allowed to enter the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]], unlike many other refugees who were refused entrance due to lack of [[coin]] or paperwork. Giftu was happy to be protected by the city walls, confident they could withstand the Absolutist siege, but Hasmet thought that Baldur's Gate simply was not secure enough to withstand the Absolutist strike, thinking they should've continued moving even further out of the Absolute's way.
